comments.creator: dj@davidjaymz.com
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8b5) Gecko/20051006 Firefox/1.4.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8b5) Gecko/20051006 Firefox/1.4.1

After a period of use FF stops allowing user requested popups and Password
authentication popups. Closing FF and reopening reactivates the popups. If a
password popup is required FF takes the user straight to the invalid access page
of the site.
Encountered problems on numourous sites inc metclub.com (password)
grassrootsx.com  (user requested popups).

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Use FF for at least 1hr. (Guestimate)
2. click a user activated popup or a password popup.
3. Popup fails
4. Close FF and reopen popups will work.
Actual Results:  
popups fail and then will work as expected when FF is restarted.

Expected Results:  
Always bring up user requested popups and password authentication popups.

comments.author: dj@davidjaymz.com
ostgote@gmx.net
comments.text:
If you set the pref dom.popup_maximum higher than the default 20 (type
about:config in the addressbar, then popup_max in the Filter input, double-click
the line for dom.popup_maximum and enter a new number), does it either stop
complaining or complain later in a session?

If so this would be a dupe of or is related to Bug 260264.
comments.creator: ostgote@gmx.net
comments.raw_text:
If you set the pref dom.popup_maximum higher than the default 20 (type
about:config in the addressbar, then popup_max in the Filter input, double-click
the line for dom.popup_maximum and enter a new number), does it either stop
complaining or complain later in a session?

If so this would be a dupe of or is related to Bug 260264.

comments.text:
Looking at bug 260264 and the comments from  ostgote@gmx.net I think this could
be a duplicate. I've increased the dom.popup_maximum to 40 and will see what
happens.

In my case its not just one site stopping though. its all sites in the current
session. If one sites popups stops all currently open sites and all subsequent
sites won't popup until after a FF reboot.
comments.creator: dj@davidjaymz.com

comments.creator: philringnalda@gmail.com
comments.text:
More likely to be bug 309775 (which does affect UI popups like password prompts
and dialogs in preferences). If you have the Web Developer toolbar installed,
it's certain to be that, if you have other extensions installed, they may be
leaking in the same way. If you go to about:config and set the pref
javascript.options.showInConsole to true, do you see the same
"(NS_ERROR_FAILURE) [nsIDOMJSWindow.open]" error in the console? (It shouldn't
take hours, just opening 12 popups.)
comments.raw_text:

mentioned error.

comments.raw_text:
This bug was reported using a version of Firefox that security and stability updates are no longer provided for.  All users are strongly encouraged to upgrade to Firefox 3 by selecting 'Check for Updates' in the Help menu or by going to http://www.mozilla.com/en-US/firefox/firefox.html

If you can no longer reproduce this bug using the latest Firefox 3.0.x version, please change the status of this bug to 'RESOLVED' 'WORKSFORME'.

If you can still reproduce this bug, please provide additional details to help resolve this issue.
